reactions.title: Williamson Ether Synthesis
reactions.notes: Classic method for unsymmetrical ethers. Use primary halides to avoid elimination.

reactions.title: Acid Cleavage with HI
reactions.mechanism: Protonation followed by SN2 attack (both primary groups)
reactions.notes: Complete cleavage to two alkyl iodides. Reactivity: HI > HBr > HCl.

reactions.title: Claisen Rearrangement
reactions.notes: Intramolecular, stereospecific. If ortho positions are blocked, goes to para position (Cope rearrangement).

reactions.title: Crown Ether-Potassium Complex
reactions.notes: 18-crown-6 perfectly fits K⁺ ion (cavity diameter ~2.6-3.2 Å, K⁺ diameter 2.66 Å). Enhances solubility of potassium salts in organic solvents.

importantEthers.name: Tetrahydrofuran (THF)
importantEthers.uses: Polymer solvent, Grignard reactions, lithium reactions

importantEthers.name: 1,4-Dioxane
importantEthers.uses: Solvent for aqueous and organic mixtures
importantEthers.properties: Carcinogenic, forms peroxides, miscible with water

importantEthers.name: Anisole
importantEthers.uses: Perfumes, solvent, precursor to other compounds

importantEthers.name: MTBE
importantEthers.properties: Groundwater contaminant, phased out in many areas

safetyTests.procedure: Add 1 mL ether to 1 mL 10% KI solution + few drops dilute HCl
safetyTests.positive: Yellow to brown color indicates peroxides
safetyTests.action: Do not distill! Treat with reducing agents (FeSO₄, Na₂SO₃)

safetyTests.procedure: Mix ether with FeSO₄ and KCNS solutions
safetyTests.action: Same as above - treat before use
